name: Get-Up-and-Go Muffins with Greek Yogurt, Oatmeal, and Blueberries
author: Chef V
summary: No oil, no butter... This muffin makes me feel not guilty about having more than just one. They are great to grab and go for a quick breakfast. The oats and Greek yogurt will keep you feeling full. Enjoy fresh from the oven or cool completely, store in an airtight container for 2 days, or pack away and freeze.
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray or line with paper liners
Whisk 2 cups flour, oats, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl
Whisk Greek yogurt, eggs, applesauce, brown sugar, water, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl
Toss blueberries with 1 teaspoon flour to prevent them from sinking to the bottom of the muffins
Fold flour mixture into the Greek yogurt mixture
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup 3/4 full
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 20 minutes
